en.title: Ansible – Lesson 6: Inventory & Hosts File
en.subtitle: Understanding Inventory, hosts file, grouping servers and connection methods

sections.heading: 1. What is Inventory in Ansible?
sections.content: Inventory is a file that contains the list of servers (managed nodes) that Ansible controls.

sections.heading: 2. What is Hosts File?
sections.content: The hosts file is the default inventory file used by Ansible. It contains IP addresses or domain names of target machines.

sections.heading: 3. Default Inventory Location
sections.content: The default inventory file is located at /etc/ansible/hosts in Linux systems.

sections.heading: 4. Simple Inventory Example
sections.content: Example: 192.168.1.10 192.168.1.11 These are two managed servers.

sections.heading: 5. Grouping Servers
sections.content: Servers can be grouped using square brackets. Example: [web] for web servers and [db] for database servers.

sections.heading: 7. Group of Groups
sections.content: You can combine groups using children. Example: [production:children] web db

sections.heading: 8. Using Hostnames Instead of IP
sections.content: You can use server hostnames instead of IP addresses in inventory.

sections.heading: 9. Ansible Connection Method
sections.content: Ansible uses SSH to connect to Linux servers and WinRM to connect to Windows servers.

sections.heading: 10. Testing Inventory Connection
sections.content: Use 'ansible all -m ping' to test connectivity with all servers.

sections.heading: 11. Custom Inventory File
sections.content: You can create your own inventory file and use it with -i option.

sections.heading: 12. Static vs Dynamic Inventory
sections.content: Static inventory is a fixed file. Dynamic inventory is generated automatically from cloud platforms.

sections.heading: Lesson 6 Summary
sections.content: You learned about Ansible inventory, hosts file, grouping servers, and how Ansible connects to managed nodes.

ta.title: Ansible – பாடம் 6: Inventory & Hosts File
ta.subtitle: Inventory, hosts file, server grouping & connection முறைகள்

sections.heading: 1. Ansible-ல் Inventory என்றால் என்ன?
sections.content: Ansible control செய்கிற அனைத்து server-களின் பட்டியல் தான் Inventory.

sections.heading: 2. Hosts File என்றால் என்ன?
sections.content: Hosts file என்பது Ansible default inventory file ஆகும். இது server IP address அல்லது domain பெயர்களை கொண்டிருக்கும்.

sections.heading: 3. Default Inventory Location
sections.content: Linux systems-ல் default inventory file /etc/ansible/hosts இடத்தில் இருக்கும்.

sections.heading: 4. Simple Inventory Example
sections.content: 192.168.1.10 192.168.1.11 போன்றவை இரண்டு managed servers ஆகும்.

sections.heading: 5. Servers-ஐ Group செய்வது
sections.content: [web], [db] போன்ற group-களாக server-களை பிரிக்கலாம்.

sections.heading: 7. Group of Groups
sections.content: Children group பயன்படுத்தி groups-ஐ combine செய்யலாம்.

sections.heading: 8. IP-க்கு பதிலாக Hostname
sections.content: Inventory file-ல் IP-க்கு பதிலாக hostname பயன்படுத்தலாம்.

sections.heading: 9. Ansible Connection Method
sections.content: Linux servers-க்கு SSH, Windows servers-க்கு WinRM பயன்படுத்தப்படுகிறது.

sections.heading: 10. Inventory Test Command
sections.content: 'ansible all -m ping' command பயன்படுத்தி server connectivity test செய்யலாம்.

sections.heading: 11. Custom Inventory File
sections.content: Custom inventory file உருவாக்கி -i option மூலம் பயன்படுத்தலாம்.

sections.heading: 12. Static & Dynamic Inventory
sections.content: Static inventory file fixed. Dynamic inventory cloud-இல் இருந்து auto-generate ஆகும்.

sections.heading: Lesson 6 Summary
sections.content: Inventory, hosts file, server grouping மற்றும் connection பற்றி நீங்கள் கற்றுக்கொண்டீர்கள்.
